org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudfoundry.client

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudfoundry.client.Connection

  • public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    implements java-cf-client create a connection to the cf provider

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connection(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String apiHost, java.lang.String organization, java.lang.String space, TransformationContext context)
      creates a connection to a cloud foundry instance will throw a transformation failure exception when no connection could established

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  java.lang.String apiHost,
                  java.lang.String organization,
                  java.lang.String space,
                  TransformationContext context)
        creates a connection to a cloud foundry instance will throw a transformation failure exception when no connection could established
        Parameters:
        username - username of the cloud foundry instance
        password - password of the cloud foundry instance
        apiHost - url to the provider
        organization - organisation of the user instance
        space - space of the user instance

    • Method Detail

      • getServices

        public java.util.List<org.cloudfoundry.operations.services.ServiceOffering> getServices()
        Returns:
        a list with all service offerings of the provider

      • getServiceCredentials

        public org.json.JSONObject getServiceCredentials(java.lang.String serviceName,
                                                 java.lang.String applicationName)
                                          throws org.json.JSONException,
                                                 com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        Method to get the service credentials which depends on the CloudFoundry instance. Therefore a connection to a CF instance is needed and the application has to be deployed and binded to the given service You can get special credentials in this way: JSONObject.getString("port")
        Returns:
        JSONObject with credentials of the given serviceId
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

      • pushApplication

        public boolean pushApplication(java.nio.file.Path pathToApplication,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.util.List<Service> services)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Creates the services Deploys the application with minimal attributes and bind application to service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
